Class.Name: Default Routing and Remote Access Class
Class.Description: User class for remote access clients

Class.Name: Default Network Access Protection Class
Class.Description: Default special user class for Restricted Access clients

Class.Name: Microsoft Windows 2000 Options
Class.Description: Microsoft vendor-specific options for Windows 2000 and above Clients

Class.Name: Microsoft Windows 98 Options
Class.Description: Microsoft vendor-specific options for Windows 98 Clients

Class.Name: Microsoft Options
Class.Description: Microsoft vendor-specific options applicable to all Windows Clients

OptionDefinition.Name: Classless Static Routes
OptionDefinition.Description: Destination, mask and router IP addresses in priority order

OptionDefinition.Name: Subnet Mask
OptionDefinition.Description: Subnet mask in network byte order

OptionDefinition.Name: Time Offset
OptionDefinition.Description: UTC offset in seconds

OptionDefinition.Name: Router
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of router addresses ordered by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: Time Server
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of time server addresses, by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: Name Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of name servers [IEN 116], by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: DNS Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of DNS servers, by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: Log Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of MIT_LCS UDP log servers on subnet

OptionDefinition.Name: Cookie Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of cookie servers, RFC 865

OptionDefinition.Name: LPR Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of RFC 1179 servers, by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: Impress Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of Imagen Impress Servers

OptionDefinition.Name: Resource Location Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of RFC 887 ResLoc Servers on subnet, by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: Host Name
OptionDefinition.Description: Host name for client, RFC 1035 character set

OptionDefinition.Name: Boot File Size
OptionDefinition.Description: Size of boot image file in 512-octet blocks

OptionDefinition.Name: Merit Dump File
OptionDefinition.Description: Path name for crash dump file

OptionDefinition.Name: DNS Domain Name
OptionDefinition.Description: DNS Domain name for client resolutions

OptionDefinition.Name: Swap Server
OptionDefinition.Description: Address of client's swap server

OptionDefinition.Name: Root Path
OptionDefinition.Description: Path name for client's root disk, char set NVT ASCII

OptionDefinition.Name: Extensions Path
OptionDefinition.Description: tftp file for option extensions

OptionDefinition.Name: IP Layer Forwarding
OptionDefinition.Description: Disable/enable IP packet forwarding on this client

OptionDefinition.Name: Nonlocal Source Routing
OptionDefinition.Description: Disable/enable nonlocal datagrams

OptionDefinition.Name: Policy Filter Masks
OptionDefinition.Description: Destination/mask IP address pairs to filter source routes

OptionDefinition.Name: Max DG Reassembly Size
OptionDefinition.Description: Maximum size datagram for reassembly by client; max 576

OptionDefinition.Name: Default IP Time-to-live
OptionDefinition.Description: Default TTL for client's use on outgoing DGs

OptionDefinition.Name: Path MTU Aging Timeout
OptionDefinition.Description: Timeout in seconds for aging Path MTU values; RFC 1191

OptionDefinition.Name: Path MTU Plateau Table
OptionDefinition.Description: MTU discovery sizes, sorted by size, all >= 68

OptionDefinition.Name: MTU Option
OptionDefinition.Description: MTU discovery size, >= 68

OptionDefinition.Name: All subnets are local
OptionDefinition.Description: The client assumes that all subnets are local

OptionDefinition.Name: Broadcast Address
OptionDefinition.Description: Broadcast address

OptionDefinition.Name: Perform Mask Discovery
OptionDefinition.Description: The client should use ICMP for subnet mask discovery.

OptionDefinition.Name: Mask Supplier Option
OptionDefinition.Description: The client should respond to subnet mask requests via ICMP.

OptionDefinition.Name: Perform Router Discovery
OptionDefinition.Description: The client should solicit routers using RFC 1256.

OptionDefinition.Name: Router Solicitation Address
OptionDefinition.Description: Address to use for router solicitation

OptionDefinition.Name: Static Route Option
OptionDefinition.Description: Destination/router address pairs, in priority order

OptionDefinition.Name: Trailer Encapsulation
OptionDefinition.Description: The client should negotiate use of trailers (RFC 983).

OptionDefinition.Name: ARP Cache Timeout
OptionDefinition.Description: Timeout in seconds for ARP cache entries

OptionDefinition.Name: Ethernet Encapsulation
OptionDefinition.Description: 0=>client should use ENet V2; 1=> IEEE 802.3

OptionDefinition.Name: TCP Default Time-to-live
OptionDefinition.Description: TTL that client uses when sending TCP segments

OptionDefinition.Name: Keepalive Interval
OptionDefinition.Description: Keepalive timeout in seconds

OptionDefinition.Name: Keepalive Garbage
OptionDefinition.Description: Send garbage octet

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS Domain Name
OptionDefinition.Description: Name of Network Information Service domain

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Addresses of NIS servers on client's subnet

OptionDefinition.Name: NTP Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: Addresses of Network Time Protocol servers

OptionDefinition.Name: Vendor Specific Info
OptionDefinition.Description: Embedded vendor-specific options

OptionDefinition.Name: WINS/NBNS Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: NBNS Address(es) in priority order

OptionDefinition.Name: NetBIOS over TCP/IP NBDD
OptionDefinition.Description: NetBIOS over TCP/IP NBDD address(es) in priority order

OptionDefinition.Name: WINS/NBT Node Type
OptionDefinition.Description: 0x1 = B-node, 0x2 = P-node, 0x4 = M-node, 0x8 = H-node

OptionDefinition.Name: NetBIOS Scope ID
OptionDefinition.Description: NetBIOS over TCP/IP Scope ID

OptionDefinition.Name: X Window System Font
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of X Windows font servers

OptionDefinition.Name: X Window System Display
OptionDefinition.Description: Array of X Windows Display Mgr servers

OptionDefinition.Name: Lease
OptionDefinition.Description: Client IP address lease time in seconds

OptionDefinition.Name: Renewal (T1) Time Value
OptionDefinition.Description: Time between addr assignment to RENEWING state

OptionDefinition.Name: Rebinding (T2) Time Value
OptionDefinition.Description: Time from addr assignment to REBINDING state

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS+ Domain Name
OptionDefinition.Description: The name of the client's NIS+ domain.

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS+ Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: A list of IP addresses indicating NIS+ servers

OptionDefinition.Name: Boot Server Host Name
OptionDefinition.Description: TFTP boot server host name

OptionDefinition.Name: Bootfile Name
OptionDefinition.Description: Bootfile Name

OptionDefinition.Name: Mobile IP Home Agents
OptionDefinition.Description: Mobile IP home agents in priority order

OptionDefinition.Name: Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of SMTP servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Post Office Protocol (POP3) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of POP3 servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Network News Transport Protocol (NNTP) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of NNTP servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: World Wide Web (WWW) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of WWW servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Finger Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of Finger servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Internet Relay Chat (IRC) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of IRC servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: StreetTalk Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of StreetTalk servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: StreetTalk Directory Assistance (STDA) Servers
OptionDefinition.Description: List of STDA servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Disable Netbios Option
OptionDefinition.Description: Option for enabling or disabling Netbios for Microsoft Windows 2000 Clients

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Release DHCP Lease On Shutdown Option
OptionDefinition.Description: Option for enabling or disabling Windows 2000 Clients to release DHCP lease on shutdown

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Default Router Metric Base
OptionDefinition.Description: Default Router Base Metrics for Microsoft Windows 2000 Clients

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Disable Netbios Option
OptionDefinition.Description: Option for enabling or disabling Netbios for Microsoft Windows 2000 Clients

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Release DHCP Lease On Shutdown Option
OptionDefinition.Description: Option for enabling or disabling Windows 2000 Clients to release DHCP lease on shutdown

OptionDefinition.Name: Microsoft Default Router Metric Base
OptionDefinition.Description: Default Router Base Metrics for Microsoft Windows 2000 Clients

Class.Name: Microsoft Windows Options
Class.Description: Microsoft vendor-specific options for Windows Clients

OptionDefinition.Name: SIP Server Domain Name List
OptionDefinition.Description: Domain Name of SIP servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Domain Search List
OptionDefinition.Description: Domain search list used by clients to resolve hostnames with DNS, by preference

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS Domain List
OptionDefinition.Description: Domain names of NIS servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS+ Domain Name List
OptionDefinition.Description: Domain names of NIS+ servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: SIP Servers IPv6 Address List
OptionDefinition.Description: IPv6 addresses of SIP servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: DNS Recursive Name Server IPv6 Address List
OptionDefinition.Description: IPv6 Addresses of DNS recursive name servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS IPv6 Address List
OptionDefinition.Description: IPv6 Addresses of NIS servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: NIS+ IPv6 Address List
OptionDefinition.Description: IPv6 Addresses of NIS+ servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: SNTP Servers IPv6 Address List
OptionDefinition.Description: IPv6 Addresses of SNTP servers available to the client

OptionDefinition.Name: Information Refresh Time
OptionDefinition.Description: This option specifies an upper bound for how long a client should wait before refreshing information retrieved from DHCPv6 Server
